George Soros is a billionaire investor and philanthropist who has donated to liberal and anti-authoritarian causes worldwide. As a result, he has long been the target of conspiracy theories, and 2020 has been no different.

Some claimed false associations between Soros and Moderna, one of the companies working to develop a coronavirus vaccine. Others baselessly claimed  he helped to finance and transport protesters to Black Lives Matter demonstrations.
Recently, a new claim surfaced: that Soros has been arrested for election-related crimes and is in federal custody in Philadelphia.
The claim first appeared Nov. 23 on Conservative Beaver, a website that brands itself as providing "stories of interest to Proud Canadians."
"According to what appears to be a recently unsealed indictment filed in the West District of Pennsylvania, Soros committed a slew of serious crimes prior to the US election," its story reads.
As evidence, its story links to photos of the purported indictment on Twitter.

"The indictment focuses only on the criminal activity Soros allegedly participated in prior to the election, such as wire fraud, identity theft, and damage to computers," it continues. "None of these claims have been proven in court, and Soros is believed innocent until proven guilty."
The claim later made its way to Facebook, where users posted screenshots of articles about the purported arrest.
Conservative Beaver and the user behind the post on Facebook have not responded to requests from USA TODAY for comment.
Fact check:Trump lawyer Sidney Powell falsely stated he won election 'by a landslide'
In reality, Soros has not been arrested for any election-related crimes. Conservative Beaver bases all its claims on photos ofan indictment — but it isn't real.
It's actually a doctored version of a bonafide indictment brought against six Russian hackers that the Department of Justice announced on Oct. 19.
In fact, that indictment is identical to the one that Conservative Beaver claims is against Soros, down to "Criminal No. 20-316" and its distinctive stamps.
Take a look at the real indictment here.
The only difference? The names of six hackers were photoshopped out, and replaced with "Schwartz Gyorgy aka George Soros."
Under his name, the photoshopped indictment still states, "Defendants," as if there were multiple individuals charged — another giveaway that it's not real.
There is no other evidence or credible media reports to suggest that Soros has been arrested or charged with any wrongdoing.
A representative from Soros' Open Society Foundations also told PolitiFact that the claim that he had been arrested is "entirely false."
Lead Stories and FactCheck.org also concluded that the claim is false.
Fact check:False claim that electronic voting software companies Dominion and Smartmatic have closed

Based on our research, the claim that George Soros was arrested in Philadelphia for election-related crimes is FALSE. Soros has not been arrested for any election-related crimes. The only evidence provided for his purported arrest was a photo of an indictment — but it isn't real. It's a doctored version of a bonafide indictment brought against six hackers in October by the Department of Justice.
